newsitem.title: USA: BMW sees U.S. sales slowdown from February.
newsitem.headline: BMW sees U.S. sales slowdown from February.

text.p: Henrich Heitmann, chairman and chief executive officer of the BMW (US) Holding Corp unit of Germany's Bayerische Motoren-Werke AG, told reporters he expects U.S. sales this calendar year to grow modestly from 1996, and not at the more than 30 percent clip the company experienced in February.
"My guess is we will end somewhere between 105,000 and 110,000," he said.
Heitmann said BMW sales will be affected by capacity constraints and by the U.S. market itself, which is expected to be generally flat in 1997 versus 1996.
BMW's U.S. sales in all of 1996 were 105,762, an increase of 13.3 percent from the prior year.
Heitmann was in New York for the New York International Auto Show.
